text:
Kazimieras Uoka (4 March 1951 – 16 July 2016) was a Lithuanian politician. He was known for being a signatory of the 1990 Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania.
He was born in Kaunas. Uoka graduated from Vilnius University in 1976. He was a leader of the labor movement in the early years of the independence movement.
Uoka died on 16 July 2016 in Vilnius, aged 65.

annotations.surface_form: Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania
